pros:
-Company listens to employees.
-You will receive opportunities to advance your career if you are willing to do the work.
-Everyone is nice and supportive.
-Work/life balance is usually good.
cons: Some employees are not held accountable when they reject tasks.
No cons that I can think of

pros: The company offers amazing benefits, flexibility and great opportunity for growth. Great work life balance.
cons: The company expects employees to come in and hit the ground running, training is poorly executed.

pros: This company has excellent benefits and culture.
cons: There are no downsides to working at NIGP.

pros: Benefits are mostly paid for by the organization, alternate work schedules, and the ability to work from home (sometimes).
cons: Rampant favoritism where preferred employees are able to take advantage of the alternate work scheduling and remote work as well as obtaining promotions that they are unqualified for.  Management has the ability to come and go as they please (they do not stay a full business day in the office).  When management cannot meet their performance objectives, the blame falls on subordinates.  Consistently reorganizing to eliminate employees who have voiced concerns about favoritism or do not fit into the management "clique."  Does not listen to suggestions from employees.   Unprofessional conduct by management where fraternization with subordinates and board members routinely occurs (private trips together and after hours during corporate events).

pros: Flexible work schedule for some, good employee benefits package, most staff are great to work with.  Experienced rapid growth through 2006-2007.
cons: Suffering from economic-induced staff reductions and unable to compensate remaining staff.  Workload inconsistently distributed.  It's becoming harder to keep up and maintain quality level. Fearful that over-worked staff will seek employment elsewhere causing additional quality/workload issues.

pros:
Flexible Work Enviornment
Excellent Employee Benefits Package
Overall Staff is friendly and inviting
Most members really appreciate the work that is done
cons: The company has slowly been regaining its momentum. They faced some difficult times due to the economy that resulted in staff layoffs and pay freezes which in some ways reduced moral. The company is very reliant on state and local government entities. If those groups are struggling financially it will impact NIGP in a negative way.

pros: Benefits are outrageous!  Alternate Friday's off, 11 Federal Holidays off, Xmas break shut down that is paid, 24 days PTO per year.  You only pay $30 a paycheck for medical/dental/vision for a no deductible plan.

review_title: Working with passionate and caring folks.
pros: The people who work here are wonderful, they are extremely supportive of life occurrences and strive to improve the organization 100%. They are very supportive of members
cons: Small organization so opportunities for vertical growth are few.

pros: Excellent environment for learning like different types of gases
cons: The growth is limited as it's small company
